pros: Kind and compassionate with a student-centered focus.
cons: Long, tedious administrative processes to complete basic functions.

review_title: Love What You Do, And You Will Be Satisfied
pros: - strong sense of HBCU pride/culture -strong alumni presence in staff (and some faculty) -opportunities for professional development (employee tuition waivers for graduate degrees/certificates)
cons: -lack of strong organizational structure -little to no opportunities for increase in salary or promotions, including job reassignments(depends on who you know) -leadership is flawed in many areas, some leaders do not care about HBCU history/mission and building upon that; it is disservice to students, faculty, staff, and the foundation of the university -leadership lacks integrity and that sometimes trickles down to employees -unorganized and always going through embarrassing cycles of financial/integral issues -faculty and staff over worked, burned out -some of the older dorms are literally uninhabitable(mold, roaches, outdated) -the cafeteria food is a hit or miss

pros: Sometimes it’s good sometimes it’s not overall it be good

pros: Pay is okay. One of the buildings was renovated in the last decade and is actually fairly nice to walk through. At the least the restrooms are clean there, and the water is cold.
cons:
I enjoy taking walks around campus during off time. What I have found is disturbing and shows that the university has suffered from a lack of maintenance dating back years:

* Exposed wiring in kitchens.
* Mouse droppings, cockroach bodies, fungus and other determent in kitchens, restrooms and other parts of the campus.
* An unbelievable number of dead trees on campus, along with dead flora (e.g. in front of the business school). One of the trees had drooping branches that were brittle; it was clear that it had been dead for some time.
* Mildew smell in my building that is persistent.
* Lack of cleaning. Mildew and other dark stains on the restrooms walls. Unidentifiable crusting around the faucets from a lack of cleaning.
* Unworkable water fountains that either project too far or feature HOT water.
* Rusty light posts. Broken curbs. Poor pavement.

Let's move onto the university as a whole. The last president, who just resigned, dropped the graduation rate from ~40% to 14% in her tenure. There have been enrollment drops as a result. Retention is extremely low. There have been major job cuts. Many positions remain unfilled as no one who is qualified would even begin to work at a place with such an uncertain future.

Some coworkers berate other employees and faculty, calling them incompetent, stupid and other unprofessional terms on an almost daily basis. Others are disgruntled due to lack of promotions and pay raises. Or in some cases, pay cuts.

pros: The students are wonderful. They created the Atwood Institute which has significant potential in terms of contributing to Kentucky's public policy milieu.
cons:
Too many to list, but I'll begin by saying: look through all the reviews and note the themes. KSU is treated like a tissue by upper administrators, use it for all it's worth then throw it away and move on to another. Tons of potential and might have been realized in the early 2000s when there was an interim president that actually cared, but he didn't get hired as the permanent. Instead, they continued the pattern of hiring users. 
My story reflects that of so many others that have been discarded by this university. Hired on as tenure-track, they changed my contract to an annual without telling me and I didn't notice when I signed it. I took FMLA, they fired me by letter right before the start of the semester. No communication with my supervisor.  Unethical and immoral, at best.

review_title: If you value yourself and your career, avoid this place ENTIRELY!!!
pros: Flexibility; a few select individuals are amazing to work with
cons: Absolutely despicable management on all levels; trickle-down politics; individuals in management will only operate on the notion of CYA for themselves; horrid procurement process, (which ultimately prevents individuals from performing their responsibilities); routine announcements suggesting the University cannot/will not pay the bills; payment process will be monthly as opposed to bi-monthly beginning in 2021; zero advancement for positions and a locked salary, etc. etc. etc.... How this place stays in operation is beyond anything...

review_title: Great Students, Great Staff, Upper Management Has Problems
pros: Most students and staff are great to work with and are very dedicated to the students.  The campus is small, and fringe benefits are very good.
cons: The climate at KSU is a problem.  Many people leave their jobs within weeks of being hired because of poor management.

review_title: It's not what you know, it's who you know
pros: There are some very nice people working here. They do provide a good amount of vacation time, including two weeks off at Christmas.
cons: Poor health insurance options. No pay increases or annual performance reviews. Turnover is very high, causing heavy workload. People get promoted based on who they're friends with, not their experience or work performance.

pros: Strong, dedicated faculty and professional staff. Small campus. Liberal Arts focus.  Mission extremely important. Long and storied history. Opportunity to make a significant difference in student lives
cons: Management was chaotic, highly bureaucratic and weak. Policies and procedures were rarely written down and often conflicted. Top-level administrators were focused on their external careers, to the detriment of the university and students.  Years of chronic underfunding from the state produced major infrastructure issues.  Technology was far behind where it should be.

pros: Frankfort is a great place to live. University has a worthwhile mission. Many good people work there.
cons: Too many administrators, not enough people actually working with stakeholders. Barely functioning infrastructure (computer systems, hiring, purchasing, building maintenance etc.). Poor community engagement. Hiring and promotion often based on who you know and what color you are.

job_title: Safety and Compliance Officer in Frankfort, KY
pros: was a great place to work for many years. then new management came in for the president down and work became VERY stressful. i see a light at the end of the tunnel though. I can foresee a beautiful future soon. As soon as the dust settles.
cons: Very Stressful currently. not for long though

pros: Since a small university, there are small class sizes.
cons: Out of date technology, working in a building that does not have heat or air conditioner.

review_title: Don't Work Here Even If You're Desperate
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Frankfort, KY
pros: The work was challenging and the interaction with the students was rewarding.
cons: The administration created an atmosphere of fear and intimidation. Staff were yelled at and bullied. Faculty were given bizarre orders and told to carry them out or be fired. No one was ever praised for doing good work but were constantly told they were failing at their jobs.
